msContents.summary: The Saptavāra ("Seven Days") usually incorporates seven dhāraṇīs, the Vasudhārā, Vajravidāraṇā, Gaṇapatihṛdaya, Uṣṇīṣavijayā, Parṇaśavarī or Prajñāpāramitā, Mārīcī, and Grahamātṛkā. This collection associates each dhāraṇī with a specific day of the week, a tradition going back to at least the sixteenth century in Nepal. This paper manuscript, dated 1801 CE, contains the Saptavāra starting with an additional Mahākāladhāraṇī and Mahākālasādhana section placed at the very beginning, and continuing with the Vasundhārānāmāṣṭottaraśataka in the place of the usual Vasudhārādhāraṇī.

msItem.title: Saptavāra
msItem.rubric: [1v1] $ oṃ namo ratnatrayāya ḥ | oṃ namo śrīvajasatvāya ḥ | oṃ namaḥ śrīvajamahākā[1v2]rāya ḥ
msItem.finalRubric: [1v4] iti śrīca¦[1v5]turbhujamāhākārasya tantraṇāmarājasya hṛdayaparivarttā nāma ḍhā[2r1]ranī palisamāptaḥ || ^^ ||
[2r4] iti śrīmahākālasādhanaṃ | kirtti[2r5]sumatibhadrasya ti2i1 samāptaḥ || ^^ || ye dharmmā hetuprabhāḥ ||
msItem.rubric: [2v1] $ oṃ namo ratnatrayāya ḥ || [space left blank for a miniature] oṃ namo śrīvajasatvāya ḥ [2v2] oṃ namaḥ buddhāya ḥ oṃ na[space left blank for a miniature]mo dharmmāya ḥ oṃ namo saṃ [2v3]ghāya ḥ oṃ namaḥ śrīma[space left blank for a miniature]hākārāya ḥ
msItem.finalRubric: [3v5] iti śrīmahākāla[4r1]tantrarāja nāma ṣatabhujasya māhākālasādhana parisamāptaḥ || @ [4r2] ḥ || ^^ ||
msItem.incipit: [4r2] namaḥ dirvya[4r3]rūpi śvarūpī | ca saumyarūpī varapradā || vasuśrī śrī[4r4]karī va[1v4]rā || dharaṇī dhāraṇī dhātā, śaraṇabhaktivatsama ḥ || prajñāpāra[1v5]mitādevi prajñā śrībuddhivarddhanī ||
msItem.finalRubric: [7r2] āryyaśrīvasundhā[7r3]rā dhā nāmāṣṭottaraśatakaṃ parisamāpta ḥ śubhaṃ || ^ ||
msItem.rubric: [7r3] oṃ namo bhagava¦[7r4]tyai āryyavajavidāriṇyaiya || namo ratnatrayāya ḥ | ^ ||
[10r4] oṃ namo bhagavatyai āryyagaṇapatīhṛdayāyai || namo ratnatrayāya [10v1] || ^^ ||
[13r3] oṃ namo bhagavatyai āryyaṣṇī[13r4]ṣav ī i jayāyai ḥ ||
[17r4] oṃ namo bhagavatya āryyapannaśavarītārāyai || namo ratnatrayāya || namo amitābhāya taṃ ||
msItem.finalRubric: [19r1] || ^^ || āryyapannaśavar i ī [19r2] nāma dhāraṇī samāpta || ^^ || @ ||
msItem.rubric: [19r2] oṃ namo bhagavatyai āryyamāricyai ya ḥ |
msItem.explicit: [32v2] atha tasya sarvvagrahā,, śādhu 2 bhagavatīti pra[32v3]ṇamya t_ bhūvanasaḥ || ^^^ || idam avocad bhagavān_ āttamanās te śca bhikṣavaḥ [32v4] bodhisattvamahāsattvā,, sā ca sarvvāvatīparṣa,, sadevamānuṣāśuragaruḍagandha[32v5]rvvaś ca loko bhagavato,, bhāṣitaḥm abhyanandan iti || ^^^ ||
msItem.colophon:
[33r1] ye dharmmā hetu,,prabhāvā,, hetu teṣāṃ [33r2] tathāgato,, -1- hy avadat teṣāṃñ ca yo nirodha evaṃvādi mahāśramanaḥ || ^^ || ¦ śreyo stu samvat eka,, netra,, durggā, māsa, māghaśuddhi 1 saṃpūrṇṇaḥ | dānapati [33r4] jajomān_, bhadrapūlimahānagalaśrīvajācāryya,rājamuṇiyāhlyasakṣatrasa[33r5]codāvarasa,atidharmmacitta bhadra-pūli-mahānagala-śrīvajācāryya,-rājamuṇiyāhlyasakṣatrasa[33r5]codāvarasa,-atidharmma-citta
utpattijayā jo,thamanaśvārddhārthanimitina[33v1] dayakā jātayājalaśubhaṃ ḥ || ^^^ || śubhaṃ maṅgalaṃ bhavantu sarvvajagatām_ ||

supportDesc.condition: Complete, generally in good condition. The first folio has traces of burning, other folios are slightly damaged at the corners.

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 27 akṣaras per line.
Double marginal frame lines. Traces of ruling. The first folio has a 5cm-wide space left blank for a miniature.

history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright in 1875.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
